title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate real GDP per capita for Clarendon for Year 2 as $20, does not calculate real GDP per capita for Sallaway for Year 2 as $25, and/or does not show the work.

( Nominal GDP GDP Deflator ×100 )÷Population=( $230 115 ×100 )÷10=$20 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6EF3@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Sallaway has the higher money supply in Year 2 and/or does not explain that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvaiaab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D14@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Sallaway has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Sallaway has the higher money supply.

The response states that Sallaway has the higher money supply in Year 2 and explains that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvaiaab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D14@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Sallaway has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Sallaway has the higher money supply.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the inflation rate in Clarendon in Year 2 as 15%, does not calculate the inflation rate in Sallaway in Year 2 as 20%, and/or does not show the work.

Year 2 GDP Deflator−Year 1 GDP Deflator Year 1 GDP Deflator ×100= 115−100 100 ×100=15% MathType@MTEF@5@5@@816E@

Year 2 GDP Deflator−Year 1 GDP Deflator Year 1 GDP Deflator ×100= 120−100 100 ×100=20% MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8166@

The response calculates the inflation rate in Clarendon in Year 2 as 15%, calculates the inflation rate in Sallaway in Year 2 as 20%, and shows the work.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Clarendon experienced the higher real interest rate and/or does not explain that Clarendon had lower inflation and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate.

The response states that Clarendon experienced the higher real interest rate and explains that Clarendon had lower inflation and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that borrowers in Clarendon will not be affected and/or does not explain the actual inflation rate was equal to the expected inflation rate.
The response states that borrowers in Clarendon will not be affected and explains the actual inflation rate was equal to the expected inflation rate.
